page.title: 14HACKLINGE AREA ECOLOGY
page.content: The area contains several relatively undisturbed habitats for wild-life. Botanists delight in the wet meadows and dykes of Worth Minnis, Hacklinge and Ham Fen. The dykes grow nationally rare plants and the fen has rare moths and butterflies. Two places in the area are designated Sites of Special Scientific Interest and such are protected and conserved. The region is rich in all kinds of wild life. Visiting swallows were fewer this year A fox reared its cubs in the derelict garden of Ilex Cottage. The slagheap was grassed and planted with 3000 trees. The Southern Water Authority maintains the streams and dykes but there has been some pollution from crop-spraying. Footpaths are in a reasonable state and are well used. Dead elms at Hacklinge are to be replaced.
